intro: Saracha microsperma, commonly known as the small-seeded saracha, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and clustered in dense inflorescences. Saracha microsperma is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or gravelly soils.
